children.value: <BasicImage src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/c_scale,w_500/v1591783100/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/custom-react-hooks/thumb_2x.png" alt="Objects hanging off a series of hooks" />
<IntroParagraph>
Last year the
React
team released a feature called "hooks" that lets you do some powerful stuff we couldn't do as easily before... Managing state. Accessing DOM elements. Using side effects.
</IntroParagraph>
It's fair to say the React community had a collective melt-down over this. For the better part of 2019, hooks turned into an all-encompassing obsession.
Hooks came with a bunch of pre-made options, but also allowed you to remix the default options to create
custom hooks
Joe Previte made a whole egghead course on Shareable Custom Hooks in React. While working through the material I made a set of illustrated notes on the main ideas
